org.eclipse.jetty.client.api

Interface Response

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContentResponse
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpContentResponse, HttpResponse

    public interface Response

    Response represents a HTTP response and offers methods to retrieve status code, HTTP version and headers.

    Response objects are passed as parameters to Response.Listener callbacks, or as future result of Request.send().

    Response objects do not contain getters for the response content, because it may be too large to fit into memory. The response content should be retrieved via content events, or via utility classes such as BufferingResponseListener.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Response.Listener
      Listener for response events

    • Method Summary

      HttpFields headers() 
      Response.Listener listener() 
      String reason() 
      int status() 
      HttpVersion version() 

    • Method Detail

      • listener

        Response.Listener listener()
        Returns:
        the response listener passed to Request#send(Listener)

      • version

        HttpVersion version()
        Returns:
        the HTTP version of this response, such as "HTTP/1.1"

      • status

        int status()
        Returns:
        the HTTP status code of this response, such as 200 or 404

      • reason

        String reason()
        Returns:
        the HTTP reason associated to the status()

      • headers

        HttpFields headers()
        Returns:
        the headers of this response

      • abort

        void abort()
        Attempts to abort the send of this request.
